title: Name this font please
content:
Can someone please name this font? Thanks for your help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 3.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%203_84.png) | 60.71 KB |
author: typeRYter

comments.content:
It's similar to Mark Simonson's [Coquette](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/coquette/), and I think we have talked about this once before. Maybe Mark will recall the conversation.

- Mike Yanega

Yes, more alternatives in [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359/http:/typophile.com/node/58038) – but no hit, although I think I have seen this very one before. There’s [another thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359/http:/dev.typophile.com/node/44092) about doing a connected version of Coquette.  
F

Thanks Florian, those are both the threads I was thinking about. Seems we don't have an answer.

- Mike Yanega

Very close to Monte Carlo Script:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/monte-carlo-script-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/monte-carlo-script-nf/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/monte-carlo-script-nf/")

Going for the grand prize...

I’m pretty sure this is a heavily modified/regularized Emily from T26 by Sylvia Janssen and Daniel Janssen.  
The x-height has been reduced and many letters have been redrawn.  
But it’s still Emily.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Emily_5136.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Emily_4927.png)

[http://www.t26.com/fonts/715-Emily](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/715-Emily "http://www.t26.com/fonts/715-Emily")

Mike Diaz :-)

[Jessica Hische](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359/http:/www.jhische.com/italianissimo.html) apparently did it at Louise Fili Ltd. Great website BTW.

Nick Cooke

Look at the lettering here:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130411234359im_/http:/typophile.com/files/omag_6565.jpg)

similar but I’m starting to think its all made from scratch.

Mikey :-)
